newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey July exports up 17 pct to $2.25 bln-exporte.
newsitem.headline: Turkey July exports up 17 pct to $2.25 bln-exporte.

text.p: Turkey's exports rose by 17 percent to $2.55 billion in July, from $1.93 billion in the same month last year, the Turkish Exporters' Assembly (TIM) said on Tuesday.
Total exports in the first seven months of this year rose 15 percent to $14.85 billion, compared to $12.88 billion in the same period of 1996.

The leading readywear sector exports increased by 22 percent last month to $690.8 million over the same month last year. This was followed by iron and steel exports, up 15 percent to $265.1 million and textile and related raw material exports, up 36 percent to $223.8 million.

The largest jump in exports last month was recorded in raw and processed hazelnut exports which leapt 49 percent from July 1996 to $32.7 million. Compared to July 1996, automotive exports fell 14 percent to $116 million.

In the first seven months of 1997, readywear exports rose 19 percent to $4.1 billion, iron and steel exports firmed 14 percent to $1.85 billion and textile and related raw material exports were up 17 percent to $1.57 billion from the same period in 1996.
According to official figures, Turkey's exports stood at $9.8 billion, imports at $17.6 billion and the trade deficit at $7.8 billion in the first five months of 1997.
